47#ifndef AM_REG_MACROS_H
48#define AM_REG_MACROS_H
49
50#ifdef __cplusplus
51extern "C"
52{
53#endif
54
55//*****************************************************************************
56//
57// For direct 32-bit access to a register or memory location, use AM_REGVAL:
58// AM_REGVAL(0x1234567) |= 0xDEADBEEF;
59//
60//*****************************************************************************
61#define AM_REGVAL(x) (*((volatile uint32_t *)(x)))
62#define AM_REGVAL_FLOAT(x) (*((volatile float *)(x)))
63
64//*****************************************************************************
65//
66// AM_REGADDR()
67// One thing CMSIS does not do well natively is to provide for static register
68// address computation. The address-of operator (e.g. &periph->reg) is helpful,
69// but does run into problems, such as when attempting to cast the resulting
70// pointer to a uint32_t. The standard C macro, offsetof() can help.
71//
72// Use AM_REGADDR() for single-module peripherals.
73// Use AM_REGADDRn() for multi-module peripherals (e.g. IOM, UART).
74//
75//*****************************************************************************
76#define AM_REGADDR(periph, reg) ( periph##_BASE + offsetof(periph##_Type, reg) )
77
78#define AM_REGADDRn(periph, n, reg) ( periph##0_BASE + \
79 offsetof(periph##0_Type, reg) + \
80 (n * (periph##1_BASE - periph##0_BASE)) )
81
82//*****************************************************************************
83//
84// Bitfield macros.
85//
86//*****************************************************************************
87#ifdef CMSIS_BFNOT
88#define AM_BFW(module, reg, field, value) \
89 (module->reg = ((module->reg & ~(module##_##reg##_##field##_Msk)) | \
90 _VAL2FLD(module##_##reg##_##field, value)))
91
92#define AM_BFR(module, reg, field) \
93 _FLD2VAL(module##_##reg##_##field, module->reg)
94
95#define AM_BFRn(module, instance, reg, field) \
96 (_FLD2VAL(module##0_##reg##_##field, \
97 *((volatile uint32_t *)(AM_REGADDRn(module, instance, reg)))) )
98
99#define AM_BFWn(module, instance, reg, field, value) \
100 (*((volatile uint32_t *)(AM_REGADDRn(module, instance, reg))) = \
101 (((*((volatile uint32_t *)(AM_REGADDRn(module, instance, reg)))) & \
102 ~(module##0_##reg##_##field##_Msk) ) | \
103 _VAL2FLD(module##0_##reg##_##field, value)) )
104
105#endif
106
107//*****************************************************************************
108//
109// Critical section assembly macros
110//
111// These macros implement critical section protection using inline assembly
112// for various compilers. They are intended to be used in other register
113// macros or directly in sections of code.
114//
115// Important usage note: These macros create a local scope and therefore MUST
116// be used in pairs.
117//
118//*****************************************************************************
119#define AM_CRITICAL_BEGIN \
120 if ( 1 ) \
121 { \
122 volatile uint32_t ui32Primask_04172010; \
123 ui32Primask_04172010 = am_hal_interrupt_master_disable();
124
125#define AM_CRITICAL_END \
126 am_hal_interrupt_master_set(ui32Primask_04172010); \
127 }
128
129//*****************************************************************************
130//
131// Register boost/reduction overflow/underflow checks and cap
132// DIFF_* - Calculate safe boost/reduction amount based on current register
133// value to avoid overflow/underflow.
134// FINAL_VAL_* - Calculate safe boost/reduce value based on register's current
135// value, and write it into the register.
136// *_BASE - Derive final capped value with base and diff provided and
137// write it into the register.
138//
139//*****************************************************************************
140#define DIFF_OVF_CAP(diff, boost, module, reg, field) \
141 diff = \
142 ( (module->reg##_b.field + boost) > ((module##_##reg##_##field##_Msk) >> (module##_##reg##_##field##_Pos)) ? \
143 (((module##_##reg##_##field##_Msk) >> (module##_##reg##_##field##_Pos)) - module->reg##_b.field) : boost );
144
145#define DIFF_UDF_CAP(diff, reduce, module, reg, field) \
146 diff = \
147 ( (module->reg##_b.field > reduce) ? \
148 reduce : module->reg##_b.field );
149
150#define FINAL_VAL_OVF_CAP(boost, module, reg, field) \
151 module->reg##_b.field = \
152 ( (module->reg##_b.field + boost) > ((module##_##reg##_##field##_Msk) >> (module##_##reg##_##field##_Pos)) ? \
153 (((module##_##reg##_##field##_Msk) >> (module##_##reg##_##field##_Pos))) : (module->reg##_b.field + boost) );
154
155#define FINAL_VAL_UDF_CAP(reduce, module, reg, field) \
156 module->reg##_b.field = \
157 ( (module->reg##_b.field > reduce) ? \
158 (module->reg##_b.field - reduce) : 0 );
159
160#define DIFF_OVF_CAP_BASE(diff, base, boost, module, reg, field) \
161 diff = \
162 ( (base + boost) > ((module##_##reg##_##field##_Msk) >> (module##_##reg##_##field##_Pos)) ? \
163 (((module##_##reg##_##field##_Msk) >> (module##_##reg##_##field##_Pos)) - base) : boost )
164
165#define DIFF_UDF_CAP_BASE(diff, base, reduce) \
166 diff = \
167 ( (base > reduce) ? \
168 reduce : base )
169
170#define FINAL_VAL_OVF_CAP_BASE(base, boost, module, reg, field) \
171 module->reg##_b.field = \
172 ( (base + boost) > ((module##_##reg##_##field##_Msk) >> (module##_##reg##_##field##_Pos)) ? \
173 (((module##_##reg##_##field##_Msk) >> (module##_##reg##_##field##_Pos))) : (base + boost) )
174
175#define FINAL_VAL_UDF_CAP_BASE(base, reduce, module, reg, field) \
176 module->reg##_b.field = \
177 ( (base > reduce) ? \
178 (base - reduce) : 0 )
179
180//*****************************************************************************
181//
182// Compiler-specific macros.
183//
184// Macros that accomplish compiler-specific tasks.
185// For example, suppression of certain compiler warnings.
186//
187//*****************************************************************************
188
189//*****************************************************************************
190// Suppress warnings for volatile variable ordering (generally IAR).
191//*****************************************************************************
192#if defined(__IAR_SYSTEMS_ICC__)
193/* Suppress IAR compiler warning about volatile ordering */
194#define DIAG_SUPPRESS_VOLATILE_ORDER() _Pragma("diag_suppress=Pa082")
195/* Restore IAR compiler warning to default */
196#define DIAG_DEFAULT_VOLATILE_ORDER() _Pragma("diag_default=Pa082")
197#else
198#define DIAG_SUPPRESS_VOLATILE_ORDER()
199#define DIAG_DEFAULT_VOLATILE_ORDER()
200#endif
201
202//*****************************************************************************
203// Suppress unused variable warnings
204// NOTE: This diagnostic suppress macro must be RARELY used!
205//*****************************************************************************
206#if defined(__IAR_SYSTEMS_ICC__)
207#define DIAG_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_VAR _Pragma("diag_suppress=Pe177")
208#define DIAG_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_VAR_DEFAULT _Pragma("diag_default=Pe177")
209
210#elif defined(__GNUC__)
211#define DIAG_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_VAR \
212_Pragma("GCC diagnostic push") \
213_Pragma("GCC diagnostic ignored \"-Wunused-variable\"")
214#define DIAG_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_VAR_DEFAULT \
215_Pragma("GCC diagnostic pop")
216
217#else
218#define DIAG_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_VAR
219#endif
220
221//*****************************************************************************
222// Suppress variable set but not used warnings
223// NOTE: This diagnostic suppress macro must be RARELY used!
224//*****************************************************************************
225#if defined(__IAR_SYSTEMS_ICC__)
226#define DIAG_SUPPRESS_SETNOTUSED_VAR _Pragma("diag_suppress=Pe550")
227#define DIAG_SUPPRESS_SETNOTUSED_VAR_DEFAULT _Pragma("diag_default=Pe550")
228
229#else
230#define DIAG_SUPPRESS_SETNOTUSED_VAR
231#define DIAG_SUPPRESS_SETNOTUSED_VAR_DEFAULT
232#endif
233
234//*****************************************************************************
235// The intrinsic for IAR's CLZ instruction is different than other compilers.
236//*****************************************************************************
237#ifdef __IAR_SYSTEMS_ICC__
238#define AM_ASM_CLZ(ui32val) __CLZ(ui32val)
239#else
240#define AM_ASM_CLZ(ui32val) __builtin_clz(ui32val)
241#endif
242
243#ifdef __cplusplus
244}
245#endif
246
247#endif // AM_REG_MACROS_H
